```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)

# load required packages
library(MASS)
library(raster)
library(rgdal)
library(rgeos)
library(tidyverse)
library(cowplot)
library(ggmap)
library(GGally)
library(DHARMa)
#library(rgrass7)
library(grainchanger) # needs installing via devtools::install_github("laurajanegraham/grainchanger")


# set ggplot options
theme_set(theme_classic() + theme(strip.background = element_blank()))

# required coordinate strings
crs_bng <- "+proj=tmerc +lat_0=49 +lon_0=-2 +k=0.9996012717 +x_0=400000 +y_0=-100000 +ellps=airy +towgs84=446.448,-125.157,542.06,0.15,0.247,0.842,-20.489 +units=m +no_defs "

crs_wgs84 <- "+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84"

# study area bounding box
convert_coords <- function(deg, min, sec) {
  coord <- deg + min/60 + sec/60^2
}

xmin <- convert_coords(2, 19, 44)
xmax <- convert_coords(1, 30, 44)
ymin <- convert_coords(50, 58, 44)
ymax <- convert_coords(51, 25, 40)


# create a 5km grid for the analysis (NB this makes the overall area slightly larger than
# originally specified - need to check against the points from Lucy when I have them as to
# how much of an issue this might be)
es_ras <- raster(extent(-xmin, -xmax, ymin, ymax), crs = crs_wgs84) %>% 
  projectExtent(crs = crs_bng)

es_grid <- as(es_ras, 'SpatialPolygonsDataFrame')

# 5km resolution
res(es_ras) <- 5000

# create polygrid
es_grid <- as(es_ras, 'SpatialPolygonsDataFrame')

# now we need a couple of buffered versions of the study area for cropping and snapping
# 10km buffer for extracting data to allow for moving window to avoid edge effects
study_bbox_10km <- gBuffer(es_grid, width = 10000, capStyle = "SQUARE", 
                           joinStyle = "MITRE", mitreLimit = 10000/2)

# 10km buffered raster at 25m resolution to snap data to
ras_10km <- raster(extent(study_bbox_10km), crs = crs(es_grid))
res(ras_10km) <- c(25, 25)

# this one for intermediary cropping of dem before transforming crs
study_bbox_20km <- gBuffer(es_grid, width = 20000, capStyle = "SQUARE", 
                           joinStyle = "MITRE", mitreLimit = 20000/2)
```

## Study area

Following @Ridding2018, the study area will use the following coordinates: `r round(extent(es_grid), 2)`. This is a bounding box around the Wessex BESS site. Note that these coordinates are slightly wider than the original study area so that we could create a 5 x 5 km grid for analysis. 

We aim to use 25 m resolution land-cover and topography data to estimate relative recreation in each 5 km resolution cell in the study area. 

## Model design

Developed during CEH meeting (2018-03-27) - key factors include access, suitability for recreation, quality for recreation.

## Data

### Recreation

We have point locations for recreation from the PPGIS study [@Ridding2018], we are going to aggregate these to get intensity within 5km resolution for the study site. 

```{r}
rec_pts <- readOGR("data", "All_PPGIS_points_LR")

rec_ras <- rasterize(rec_pts, es_ras, 'LUCY_FID', fun=function(x,...)length(x))

plot(rec_ras)
```

## Environment

LCM 2015 [@Rowland2017] data were downloaded from Edina Digimap.EU-DEM data were downloaded from [European Environment Agency](https://www.eea.europa.eu/data-and-maps/data/copernicus-land-monitoring-service-eu-dem).

```{r load_env, eval = FALSE}
# Land cover map
lcm <- raster("~/DATA/LULC/lcm2015/lcm2015gb25m.tif")
lcm_site <- resample(lcm_site, ras_10km, method = "ngb")
plot(lcm_site)
writeRaster(lcm_site, "data/lcm_site.tif", overwrite = TRUE)

# DEM 
dem <- raster("~/DATA/PHYSICAL/elev/eu_dem_1.1/eudem_dem_3035_europe.tif")
study_bbox_dem <- spTransform(study_bbox_20km, crs(dem))
dem_site <- crop(dem, study_bbox_dem)
# all data going to be transformed to same as the LCM data. 
dem_site <- projectRaster(dem_site, crs = crs(lcm))
dem_site <- crop(dem_site, lcm_site)
dem_site <- resample(dem_site, lcm_site)
crs(dem_site) <- crs(lcm)
plot(dem_site) 
storage.mode(dem_site[]) = "integer" # reduces file size by 2/3, decimals not really needed
writeRaster(dem_site, "data/dem_site.tif", overwrite = TRUE)
```

## Variables

All variables will be created from either LCM or Elevation (or a combination).

### Access

Proportion that is urban (20) or suburban (21) within a 2km radius (for now) window

```{r calc_access, cache = TRUE}
system.time(access <- winmove(lcm_site, 2000, "rectangle", "prop", lc_class = c(20, 21)))
access <- crop(access, es_grid)
save(access, file = "results/access.Rda")
```

```{r}
load("results/access.Rda")
plot(access)
```


### Land-cover suitability

Local scale (i.e. cell scale) binary measure when LC is in all except for urban (20), suburban (21), freshwater (14), saltwater (13). This list may need revising. 

```{r calc_suitable, cache = TRUE}
check_suitable <- function(x) {
  ifelse(x %in% c(0, 13, 14, 20, 21), 0, 1)
}

lc_suitable <- raster::calc(lcm_site, fun = check_suitable)
lc_suitable <- crop(lc_suitable, es_grid)
save(lc_suitable, file = "results/lc_suitable.Rda")
```

```{r}
load("results/lc_suitable.Rda")
plot(lc_suitable)
```

### Land-cover diversity

Shannon diversity of all LC classes (argument for this is that as long as it's mixed with natural stuff, view of villages etc. is nice??) within (a) viewshed or (b) 5km square window. Viewshed should be calculated within r.viewshed in grass - can use the execGRASS function in rgrass7. This is not ideal (if we want to create package etc.) but will have to do for now.

Thoughts on how to do (a):

- firstly, check whether it makes any difference (for a sample of points - n = 100? - compare the value from viewshed version and the value from a straight up Shannon calculation - can compare with correlation or paired t-test)
- build the r.viewshed call into a function for winmoveR
- have a look at the [c++ total viewshed code](https://github.com/tombh/total-viewsheds) and see if I can build in Shannon diversity calculation into this: this will involve adding code between the 0/1 viewshed calculation and the total area visible per cell calculation; the Shannon calculation on the multiplied surfaces can then be used.

```{r calc_diversity_vs, eval = FALSE}
initGRASS(gisBase = "C:/Program Files/GRASS GIS 7.4.0", home = "data", 
          gisDbase = "data",
          location = "grass_data", mapset = "PERMANENT", override = TRUE)

execGRASS("g.proj", flags = c("c", "quiet"), 
          proj4 = proj4string(lcm_site))
b_box = extent(lcm_site) 
execGRASS("g.region", flags = c("quiet"), 
          n = as.character(b_box[4]), s = as.character(b_box[3]), 
          e = as.character(b_box[2]), w = as.character(b_box[1]), 
          res = "1")

writeRAST(as(lcm_site, "SpatialGridDataFrame"), vname = "lcm_site")
writeRAST(as(dem_site, "SpatialGridDataFrame"), vname = "dem_site")

pts_sample <- pts[sample(1:nrow(pts), 100), 1:2]

calc_viewshed_diversity <- function(coords) {
  
  execGRASS("g.region", 
            n = as.character(coords[2] + 5000), 
            s = as.character(coords[2] - 5000), 
            e = as.character(coords[1] + 5000), 
            w = as.character(coords[1] - 5000))
  
  dtime <- str_extract_all(Sys.time(), "\\d+", simplify = TRUE) %>% str_flatten
  vs_tempfile <- paste0("vs_", dtime)
  ls_tempfile <- paste0("ls_", dtime)
  area_tempfile <- paste0("area_", dtime)
  execGRASS(cmd = "r.viewshed", input = "dem_site", output = vs_tempfile, 
            coordinates = coords, memory = 20000)
  execGRASS(cmd = "r.mapcalc", expression = paste0(area_tempfile, ' = if(', vs_tempfile, ')'), 
            flags = "overwrite")
  execGRASS(cmd = "r.mapcalc", expression = paste0(ls_tempfile, ' = if(', vs_tempfile, ') * lcm_site'), 
            flags = "overwrite")
  vs <- readRAST(vs_tempfile) %>% raster
  lc <- readRAST(ls_tempfile) %>% raster
  area <- readRAST(area_tempfile) %>% raster
  
  div <- diversity(lc, lc_class = 1:21)
  area <- sum(as.vector(vs), na.rm = TRUE)
  execGRASS("g.remove", name = c(vs_tempfile, ls_tempfile, area_tempfile), type = "raster", flags = "f")
  return(list(div = div, area = area))
}

strt <- Sys.time()
vs_lc_div <- lapply(1:nrow(pts_sample), function(x) {
  coords <- as.numeric(pts_sample[x,])
  calc_viewshed_diversity(coords)
})
vs_lc_div_calctime <- Sys.time() - strt


strt <- Sys.time()
pts_sample$win_lc_div <- apply(pts_sample, 1, function(coords) {
  xmin = coords[1] - 5000
  xmax = coords[1] + 5000 
  ymin = coords[2] - 5000 
  ymax = coords[2] + 5000 
  
  lcm_sml <- crop(lcm_site, extent(c(xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)))
  diversity(lcm_sml, lc_class = 1:21)
}) 
win_lc_div_calctime <- Sys.time() - strt

ggplot(pts_sample, aes(x = win_lc_div, y = vs_lc_div)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")

files <- list.files("data/grass_data/PERMANENT/cell/", pattern = "vs_")
```

Currently the viewshed calculation takes a long time for each cell. Going for option (b) for now and calculating within a square window.

## Recreation model

Gonna multiply each predictor by land cover suitability to get a surface of potential recreation quality, aggregate, then fit to recreation data. 

```{r, eval = FALSE}
access_5km <- aggregate(access * lc_suitable, 200) 
lc_diversity_5km <- aggregate(lc_diversity * lc_suitable, 200)
topo_5km <- aggregate(topo * lc_suitable, 200)

all_data <- stack(list(rec = rec_ras, access = access_5km, lc_diversity = lc_diversity_5km, topo = topo_5km)) %>% 
  as.data.frame(xy = TRUE) %>% 
  na.omit

ggpairs(all_data %>% select(-x, -y))

ggplot(all_data, aes(x = rec)) + geom_histogram()
```

```{r, eval = FALSE}
rec_mod <- glm.nb(rec ~ access * lc_diversity * topo, data = all_data)
rec_mod_r2 <- 1 - (rec_mod$deviance / rec_mod$null.deviance)

summary(rec_mod)
rec_mod_r2
```

```{r, eval = FALSE}
library(DHARMa)
simulationOutput <- simulateResiduals(fittedModel = rec_mod, n = 250)

plotSimulatedResiduals(simulationOutput)
```

Idea here is to demonstrate that if we only have data on LC and elevation, if we model at the right scale and with an understanding of the generating mechanism, we may get something akin to the relative ES values. A kind of improved benefit transfer. 

Recreation = (access + LC diversity + topographic heterogeneity) * LC suitability

```{r output_recmod, eval = FALSE}
rec <- (access + lc_diversity + topo) * lc_suitable
all_data <- stack(list(access = access, lc_suitable = lc_suitable, 
                       lc_diversity = lc_diversity, topo = topo, rec = rec))


plot(all_data)
save(all_data, file = "results/all_data.rda")
save(rec, file = "results/rec_pred.rda")
```

Now let's aggregate the recreation model and compare it to the data

```{r, eval = FALSE}
load("results/rec_pred.rda")
rec_pred <- aggregate(rec, fact = 200)
rec_comp <- stack(list(rec_data = rec_ras, rec_pred = rec_pred)) %>% 
  as.data.frame(xy = TRUE) %>% na.omit

rec_data_plot <- ggplot(rec_comp, aes(x = x, y = y, fill = rec_data)) + 
  geom_raster() + 
  scale_fill_viridis_c() + 
  coord_equal() + 
  theme(axis.text = element_blank(), axis.title = element_blank(), axis.ticks = element_blank())

rec_pred_plot <- ggplot(rec_comp, aes(x = x, y = y, fill = rec_pred)) + 
  geom_raster() + 
  scale_fill_viridis_c() + 
  coord_equal() + 
  theme(axis.text = element_blank(), axis.title = element_blank(), axis.ticks = element_blank())

plot_grid(rec_data_plot, rec_pred_plot)

ggplot(rec_comp, aes(x = rec_data, y = rec_pred)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "glm")

cor_test <- cor.test(rec_comp$rec_data, rec_comp$rec_pred, method = "spearman")
```

Ouch, spatially look very different and small non-significant correlation between the two. Let's have a look in more detail. 

```{r, eval = FALSE}
mod <- lm(rec_data ~ rec_pred, data = rec_comp)
summary(mod)
```

Significant model, and the slope of the predicted recreation value on the actual value is positive and significant BUT very low $R^2$ value. Where are the residuals and do they correlate with any of our predictors? 

```{r, eval = FALSE}
rec_comp$resid <- mod$residuals

ggplot(rec_comp, aes(x = x, y = y, fill = resid)) + 
  geom_raster() + 
  scale_fill_viridis_c() + 
  coord_equal() + 
  theme(axis.text = element_blank(), axis.title = element_blank(), axis.ticks = element_blank())

rec_resid_pts <- SpatialPointsDataFrame(coords = cbind(rec_comp$x, rec_comp$y), 
                                        data = rec_comp, proj4string = crs(crs_bng))
rec_resid_ras <- rasterize(rec_resid_pts, es_ras, 'resid')

load("results/all_data.rda")

all_data_5km <- stack(list(residuals = rec_resid_ras, aggregate(all_data, fact = 200)))

plot(all_data_5km)
```

Where are these residuals - plot on background map: 

```{r, eval = FALSE}
rec_resid_pts <- spTransform(rec_resid_pts, CRSobj = crs_wgs84)
rec_resid <- data.frame(rec_resid_pts@coords, rec_resid_pts@data)


study_bbox <- c(left = -xmin, bottom = ymin, right = -xmax, top = ymax)
mp <- get_map(location = study_bbox) 
ggmap(mp) + 
  geom_point(data = rec_resid, aes(x = coords.x1, y = coords.x2, colour = resid), size = 10, shape = "square", alpha = 0.6)
```

The high values that we miss are around Salisbury and the Wessex Downs.
